result.execSummary:
All charges against Thomas J Washington in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas J Washington is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Washington

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Nimmer.

10:32 AM Defendant Thomas J Washington in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Thomas J Washington.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Waukesha County Detective Ryan Roeglin sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Nickolie.  
Cross examination by Atty. Nimmer.  State rests.  Testimony close.
Atty. Nickolie moves for bind over.  Atty. Nimmer makes closing statements.  
Court heard the date of 4/20/2022 and did not hear the date of 4/20/2021. Court does not find probable cause.  Court orders case dismissed and dismisses both charges.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:39 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Thomas J Washington in court with Atty. Amanda Nimmer as a friend of the Court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Nimmer notes the defendant did not previoulsy qualify for a Public Defender, but his circumstanes have changed and he will now qualify.  However, another attorney will need to be appointed.  Atty. Nimmer notes that this matter still needs to be set for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court will schedule this matter for a preliminary hearing and will tag 22CF203 along with for status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Motion hearing on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed by Atty Nimmer requesting an adjournment of the 7/12/22 motion hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Lau - no objection by the State - adjourn request granted.**
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:55 PM Defendant Thomas J Washington in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter before the Judge to tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Thomas J Washington not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State has no objection to the Court staying a capias and adjourning the initial appearance.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance to tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
